intro: Podochilus serpyllifolius, commonly known as common yarrow. It is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae, characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and thrives in dry, open habitats. Podochilus serpyllifolius is often used in traditional medicine and as a garden plant due to its ornamental value.
